Inference: Soil moisture rising during rain detections while water usage drops indicates effective rainfall replacement
Description: Natural rainfall is sufficient to maintain or increase soil moisture, allowing irrigation to decrease.
short rationale: Operational insight on rainfall replacing irrigation; minimal privacy risk.

Inference: Soil moisture falling during rain detections despite water usage reduction indicates insufficient rainfall intensity
Description: Rain is detected but does not provide enough water to prevent soil moisture decline.
short rationale: Shows weak rain events affecting irrigation planning.

Inference: Soil moisture rising significantly during rain detections and low water usage indicates strong storm or heavy precipitation
Description: Large moisture increases show rainfall alone is responsible for hydration.
short rationale: Identifies heavy rain impact; low sensitivity.

Inference: Soil moisture unchanged during rain detections and low water usage suggests canopy interception or rainfall not reaching the soil
Description: Water is detected by sensors but does not infiltrate the soil effectively.
short rationale: Points to infiltration barriers; operational context only.

Inference: Soil moisture falling during long rain-detection gaps and increasing water usage indicates drought response
Description: Lack of rainfall forces irrigation to compensate for declining moisture.
short rationale: Shows drought adaptation and irrigation load; moderate operational sensitivity.

Inference: Soil moisture rising during periods of minimal water usage and frequent rain detections confirms rainy-season dominance
Description: Rainfall fully meets hydration needs without irrigation.
short rationale: Indicates seasonality of rain vs irrigation; low privacy impact.

Inference: Soil moisture falling despite high water usage and no rain detections indicates severe dryness or rapid evapotranspiration
Description: Environmental demand exceeds both rainfall and irrigation contributions.
short rationale: Highlights severe dryness driving high use; moderate operational signal.

Inference: Soil moisture rising during high water usage and no rain detections suggests irrigation is effectively hydrating the soil
Description: Increased water usage compensates for lack of rainfall and improves moisture.
short rationale: Shows irrigation efficacy; minimal privacy risk.

Inference: Soil moisture stable during fluctuating water usage and intermittent rain detections indicates strong soil buffering capacity
Description: Soil retains water well despite variable input from irrigation and rainfall.
short rationale: Indicates soil buffering; low sensitivity.

Inference: Water usage dropping sharply during rain detections with soil moisture rising confirms correct system responsiveness
Description: The system is properly stopping irrigation once rain provides sufficient hydration.
short rationale: Confirms control responsiveness; low privacy impact.

Inference: Water usage remaining high during rain detections with soil moisture rising rapidly suggests overlapping irrigation and rainfall
Description: Irrigation may be mistimed or unable to respond quickly to rainfall events.
short rationale: Shows overlap of irrigation and rain; modest operational detail.

Inference: Water usage remaining high during rain detections with soil moisture falling indicates irrigation inefficiency or misconfiguration
Description: Even combined rainfall and irrigation fail to improve moisture.
short rationale: Signals misconfigured irrigation under rain; moderate operational sensitivity.

Inference: Soil moisture rising only slightly during rain detections and high water usage indicates shallow rainfall penetration
Description: Rain does not infiltrate deeply and irrigation adds only modest moisture.
short rationale: Suggests shallow rainfall; low privacy risk.

Inference: Soil moisture rising steeply during rain detections regardless of water usage indicates rainfall-driven hydration dominance
Description: Irrigation becomes secondary because rain provides most soil water.
short rationale: Rain-dominant hydration insight; minimal sensitivity.

Inference: Periods of zero water usage with soil moisture still rising during rain detections indicate irrigation fully suspended due to rainfall
Description: Rain alone hydrates the soil, preventing irrigation cycles.
short rationale: Shows automatic suspension; very low sensitivity.

Inference: Periods of high water usage during rain-detection gaps with soil moisture still falling indicate rapid water loss from soil
Description: Evaporation or deep percolation removes water quickly even during heavy irrigation.
short rationale: Highlights rapid loss despite irrigation; moderate operational impact.

Inference: Soil moisture consistently high during alternating rain detections and low water usage indicates sustained wet-season saturation
Description: Rain events keep soil moisture elevated without irrigation support.
short rationale: Wet-season saturation signal; low privacy concern.

Inference: Soil moisture consistently low during alternating rain detections and high water usage indicates rainfall ineffectiveness
Description: Rain is detected but not strong or frequent enough to penetrate the soil.
short rationale: Shows ineffective rain; modest operational context.

Inference: Water usage spikes after rain-detection periods with falling soil moisture indicate recovery irrigation after minor rainfall
Description: Rainfall was not strong enough, prompting irrigation boosts once rain stops.
short rationale: Recovery irrigation behavior; low sensitivity.

Inference: Water usage remains low after rain detections and soil moisture stays high, indicating prolonged post-rain soil saturation
Description: The soil remains wet long after the rain stops, reducing irrigation needs.
short rationale: Indicates sustained saturation; very low sensitivity.

Inference: Soil moisture falling before rain detections and rising during rainfall with reduced water usage indicates accurate weather synchronization
Description: Rainfall timing aligns perfectly with soil moisture behavior and irrigation reduction.
short rationale: Shows good synchronization; minimal privacy risk.

Inference: Soil moisture falling before rain detections and continuing to fall during rainfall with low water usage indicates insufficient stormwater absorption
Description: Rainfall does not provide meaningful soil moisture improvement.
short rationale: Highlights poor absorption; low sensitivity.

Inference: Soil moisture rising after rain detections even with zero water usage indicates delayed rainfall infiltration
Description: Water takes time to percolate downward, increasing moisture after rain ends.
short rationale: Shows delayed infiltration; minimal privacy concern.

Inference: Soil moisture falling after rain detections even with rising water usage indicates deep moisture deficit
Description: Irrigation and rain cannot replenish deeper soil layers immediately.
short rationale: Reveals deep deficits driving high use; moderate operational sensitivity.

Inference: Stable soil moisture during frequent rain detections and low water usage indicates soil saturation equilibrium
Description: Moisture has reached a point where additional rainfall cannot increase it further.
short rationale: Shows saturation equilibrium; low sensitivity.

Inference: Stable soil moisture during rare rain detections and low water usage indicates minimal environmental water demand
Description: Soil loses moisture slowly regardless of rainfall or irrigation.
short rationale: Indicates low demand; very low privacy impact.

Inference: Water usage rising during rain-detection gaps with soil moisture rising too indicates irrigation oversupply
Description: Moisture increases even without rain, suggesting irrigation volumes may be too high.
short rationale: Points to possible overwatering; low sensitivity.

Inference: Water usage rising during rain-detection gaps but soil moisture falling indicates strong environmental drying forces
Description: Evaporation or soil characteristics prevent moisture retention even with irrigation.
short rationale: Shows strong drying despite irrigation; moderate operational exposure.

Inference: Water usage dropping during rain detections but soil moisture falling indicates inadequate rainfall volume
Description: The system stops watering due to rain signals, but rainfall does not sufficiently hydrate the soil.
short rationale: Indicates rainfall insufficiency under shutoff; modest sensitivity.
